channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14534] Bump yammer/coda/dropwizard metrics dependency version
item.description: After HBASE-12911 lands, let's update our dependency to the latest incarnation of this library. I guess they're now calling it Dropwizard Metrics.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Thanks for picking this one up. Here's a patch I started a (long) while back, was mostly sed, but should be well on the way.

Thanks Nick Dimiduk, too bad I guess I've repeated most of that today but anyway there're some pretty significant changes in API, so manual work after scripts anyway.

Btw, I mostly picked it up (and found it) looking to json metrics output (see referenced jira for web ui for regions and store files) - would appreciate if you take a look at the WIP/pictures there.
Nice work over on HBASE-7171!

Here's patch, compilable and local cluster runs and shows metrics, looking into weird things. Checking affected places like PE tool, WAL pe, pretty printer.

Also among the changes - I had to modify HFPP, as in new API it become hard to extend ConsoleReporter, so I just wrote one subclassing from ScheduledReporter.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12776382/HBASE-14534.patch
against master branch at commit 63f2ebca1371a1f83ac7c2f4b43b8ffb744d6672.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12776382

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 21 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.6.1 2.7.0 2.7.1)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 checkstyle. The applied patch generated new checkstyle errors. Check build console for list of new errors.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ assertEquals("", runnerStats.delayIntevalHist.getSnapshot().getMean(), (double)backoffTime, 0.1);
+ <shadedPattern>org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shaded.com.dropwizard</shadedPattern>

+1 site. The mvn post-site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

+1 zombies. No zombie tests found running at the end of the build.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16793//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16793//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16793//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16793//console

This message is automatically generated.
Nick Dimiduk any feedback? I'm fixing few small things, will post updated patch shortly.

Updated patch, fixed some long lines, fixed metric name in HTPP, rebased to current master. Verified HFPP output on web page and metrics dump there.

Question - how to better test metrics change didn't get changed anywhere (besides just looking with one's eyes)?

Also looks like dropwizard made some changes in their approach to metrics..one of the things, now by default histograms are using exponential decay rather than uniform sampling, is that ok for us to follow this approach here?

Skimmed patch, LGTM.

Question - how to better test metrics change didn't get changed anywhere (besides just looking with one's eyes)?

Good question. IIRC, we have nothing like this in place. At best, we would audit changes to class names and/or constants. Agreed we should make better guarantees for our operators.

now by default histograms are using exponential decay rather than uniform sampling, is that ok for us to follow this approach here?

I think that's fine for a major version release. A release note is warranted.

Oops, I meant "metric names didn't get changed", sorry. Thanks Nick Dimiduk, will commit when we have build bot run, unless objections.

cc Elliott Clark, Enis Soztutar - once this one is in, I'd say we can proceed with HFPP refactoring.

I think that's fine for a major version release. A release note is warranted.

Do you think it should only go in branch-2?

I believe so yes. I haven't looked at our compatibility guide re: dependency libraries. It may be that we can backport it to unreleased 1.x versions, so long as we also package/ship the old version (they're entirely different APIs, so technically there's no the same problems we have with Guava or Jackson).
Yeah, yammer/codahale/dropwizard APIs differ a lot between versions, so it's not just binary imcompatibility, and packaging 2 versions of them in any branch doesn't look reasonable.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12776976/HBASE-14534-v2.patch
against master branch at commit 22b95aebcd7fc742412ab514520008fda5e327de.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12776976

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 21 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.6.1 2.7.0 2.7.1)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 checkstyle. The applied patch generated new checkstyle errors. Check build console for list of new errors.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn post-site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

+1 zombies. No zombie tests found running at the end of the build.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16836//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16836//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html

This message is automatically generated.
Nick Dimiduk - are you +1 on v2 patch? anyone else would like to take a look (stack ?)
+1 Looks good to me for master.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Updated yammer metrics to version 3.1.2 (now it's been renamed to dropwizard). API has changed quite a bit, consult https://dropwizard.github.io/metrics/3.1.0/manual/core/ for additional information.

Note that among other things, in yammer 2.2.0 histograms were by default created in non-biased mode (uniform sampling), while in 3.1.0 histograms created via MetricsRegistry.histogram(...) are by default exponentially decayed. This shouldn't affect end users, though.
